numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that the younger generation in this data is more optimistic about the future.
2. The younger generation is the age-group 15-24.
3. The younger generation believes that life improves with each generation.
4. The x-axis represents people who are older than 40 years.
5. The y-axis represents people who are 15-24 years old.
6. This graph includes 21 countries.
7. According to the data, Indonesia has the highest score.
8. According to the data, Mali has the lowest score.
9. Indonesia is the only country in which more than 75% of people who are 15-24 years old believe that the world is improving.
10. Some countries are optimistic in both age-groups.
11. Nigeria is a LIC.
12. Ethiopia is a LIC.
13. Nigeria is optimistic in both age-groups.
14. Ethiopia is optimistic in both age-groups.
15. Some countries have a higher HDI.
16. If a country has a higher HDI then the percentage of optimistic young people in this country is higher than the percentage of optimistic people who are older than 40 years in this country.
17. People who are 25-39 years old were not involved in this survey.
18. I wonder why the survey excluded people who are 25-39 years old.
19. I wonder why Mali got the lowest score.
20. I wonder why older people are less optimistic than younger people.
21. My nation is not included in this survey.
22. I have not thought about whether the world is becoming a better place or a worse place compared with each generation.
23. I believe that this graph is relevant.
24. In my opinion, each generation can make a better future.
25. This graph increases my interest in learning more about our thought processes.
26. This graph increases my interest in determining whether further developments are achievable.
27. The headline is: Is our future getting better or worse?
